descriptionNullable:
### Context

I collected all the entries for 2020s hot 100 charts provided by Billboard to see which songs were relevant during that year. 


### Content

The data was aquired crawling the webpages for each week, eg.  [https://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100/2020-12-19](https://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100/2020-12-19).

According to Billboard, the charts are influecend by airplay and sales between Friday and Thursday and are refreshed on Tuesdays. ([Billboard Charts Legend](https://www.billboard.com/p/billboard-charts-legend))

| column | description |
| --- | --- |
| *rank* | rank of the song in this specific week |
| *artist* | artist or group of artists that worked on the song |
| *song* | title of the song |
| *rank last week* | rank of the song in the last weeks chart, first appearing songs are labeled with a `0` |
| *peak rank* | highest rank so far |
| *weeks on chart* | number of weeks were the song was in the charts |
| *date* | date of week, starting on Saturday |

### Acknowledgement

Without the [Scrapy](https://scrapy.org/) package, I wouldn't have been able to crawl Billboard and get all the data. 

### Inspiration

You can use this data to analyse what kind of songs are listend to by the public and how it gets influenced by seasons. 
You could also use this data as a foundation for projects analysing the lyrics of this year. (I might add a dataset with all the lyrics later)
title: Billboard Hot 100 Weekly Charts 2020
subtitle: The 'hottest' songs of every week

| column | description |
| --- | --- |
